results.title: Product Marketing Director, GovCon ERP
results.description:
The Product Marketing Director will define and enable Unanet‚Äôs Go-To-Market Strategy for our ERP solution for Government Contractors (GovCon) and work with our Director of CRM on aligning our CRM story, message and integration between ERP and CRM for GovCon. This is an outstanding opportunity to develop marketing-problem-oriented messaging, positioning and to be the public voice of our ERP solution to internal and external audiences.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Be the clear and enthusiastic voice of the customer and market for the GovCon market
  • Lead and excite cross functional groups, in particular sales, about the market opportunity and how we uniquely solve it
  • Create a solution-based story that you use to enable sales, the company, and the market
  • Understand and continuously develop understanding of Unanet‚Äôs portfolio of products; translate technical features into messages that resonate with the broader market
  • Present at company and industry events as a thought leader and a product expert
  • Create and execute Go-to-Market (GTM) strategy and plans
  • Define buyer personas, needs and map to the buyer journey
  • Develop differentiated, value-based messaging in the language of the buyer for a variety of communication channels
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams in the planning and execution of successful product launches
  • Assist in the development and delivery of sales enablement materials, including but not limited to presentations, playbooks, and scripts
  • Understand the competitive landscape and develop competitive intelligence tools to support sales and marketing programs
  • Collaborate closely with Product Management to influence the product roadmap, understand product updates, do competitive analysis, and enable sales
  • Create a content strategy and work with the extended marketing team on executing key thought leadership and content for example, eBooks, webinars, and presentations at events
  • Track and analyze the effectiveness of product marketing activities through the measurement of key metrics
  • Collaborate with other product marketing managers on the team to create vertical based stories to bring to market
  • Hone product marketing skills to be an example of industry excellence

First 90 days

  • In your first 30 days, you will become familiar with our customers, products, the industries we serve, and our approach to marketing, sales, and customer success. You will immerse yourself in product education, working closely with colleagues to learn about our people and the processes that make Unanet run.
  • In your first 60 days, you will establish relationships, trust and rapport with the product marketing team, product management and sales, as well as others across our company. You will manage the launches with product management and prepare enablement sessions for company readiness.
  • In your first 90 days, you have a strong understanding of our market and product offerings. You are able to speak and write credibly about our solutions with customers and prospects. You will have established yourself as the go-to person, leader and problem solver on all things GovCon ERP product marketing.

¬†¬†Who You Are

  • 7+ years of product marketing experience in B2B software
  • Experience with Pragmatic Marketing principals
  • Proficiency with business productivity applications, preferably in the GovCon industry
  • Demonstrable analytical experience used to markedly improve customer development, product adoption, and sales process via relevant metrics (e.g., Content Effectiveness, Win Rate, Market Penetration)
  • Experience performing research and building competitive analyses, as well as presenting to a diverse Sales organization
  • Clear and succinct written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to travel to customer and/or partner sites, conferences, or other field events, as well as quarterly working sessions

Differentiators

  • MBA
  • Experience in a high-growth B2B software environment
  • Experience in the Government Contracting industries

¬†Our Values

  • We are a Team. Employees, customers, and partners working together.
  • We are Customer-Focused. Customers are the heart of everything we do.
  • We are Driven. Seeking exceptional outcomes.
  • We Own our Success. Every employee has a stake in our company.
  • We do the right thing and have fun in the process.

The salary range for this opportunity is $140,000 - $155,000 per year. You will be eligible for discretionary bonus compensation, subject to plans that may be in effect from time to time. You will further be eligible to participate in Unanet‚Äôs employee benefits plans and programs. For more details on Unanet‚Äôs benefits offerings, please visit https://unanet.com/employee-benefits¬†

Unanet is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for positions without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Head of Product - Rider Experience
results.description:
Description

About Masabi:

At Masabi, we are helping to make cities better places to live, work, and visit by enabling seamless, frictionless journeys on public transport systems. We are a SaaS company developing a fare collection platform that allows people to buy and present tickets for public transit on their mobile phones or by tapping a bank card or smart card to travel.¬†

¬†

We believe a new fare payments system allowing passengers to tap and ride without needing to buy a ticket or understand fares should be available to every passenger and every transit agency around the globe, without prohibitive costs or taking years to deliver, helping people move seamlessly from A to B.

¬†

Our Justride platform has won numerous awards and is used in over 150 locations worldwide, including New York, London, Boston, Las Vegas, Valencia, The Hague, Los Angeles, Melbourne, and many more. With an exciting industry-first mobile ticketing SDK, we are partnering with companies like Uber, Lyft, Transit, Moovit to enable the purchase of public transit tickets within leading mobility applications.

¬†

Join us on this exciting ride as we build the transit technology ecosystem of tomorrow.

¬†

¬†

The Role:¬†

We‚Äôre looking for a Head of Rider Experience Products to own the products and integrations that Masabi builds to make riding transit an easy and enjoyable experience for our global users.¬†

¬†

The primary focus for this role will be Masabi‚Äôs app, web portal, and partner integrations across the broader mobility space, with a broader view of the rider's experience across our platform as they plan, use, and pay for transit and mobility services, interacting with both digital and physical channels.¬†

¬†

Using a deep understanding of the diverse transit riders and agencies we serve, and working with internal and external partners, you will work on developing a roadmap that creates new value for riders, agencies, and the Masabi business.

¬†

¬†

Location: This role is available for candidates in Canada, anywhere on the EST time zone

¬†

¬†

Responsibilities:¬†

  • Define the product vision for the Rider Experience area, identifying near and long-term initiatives to build your product roadmap
  • Set the overall strategy for Masabi Rider Experience products and partnerships, defining the product offerings that agencies need (as well as those they don‚Äôt even know they need) and working with customer-facing teams on go-to-market approaches
  • Use your experience with transit apps and data as well as customer experience enablement to innovate on rider journeys and agencies‚Äô ability to serve and engage with them, identifying opportunities to drive ridership, satisfaction, and adoption
  • Develop a deep understanding of the marketplace for rider experience technology, including transit rider needs and challenges, and emerging trends and technologies
  • Understand the specific needs and opportunities of target markets and segments in a diverse global context
  • Identify, evaluate, and execute partnership opportunities that enhance the Rider Experience, managing relationships with current and future partners for your area
  • Oversee successful delivery across your product area, and support notable launches that result in enhanced client and rider adoption and satisfaction
  • Manage complex cross-functional dependencies with product and engineering leaders to ensure a holistic approach across the portfolio and take the lead on advocating for the rider experience across the product portfolio¬†¬†
  • Build and foster a strong team culture with a focus on execution and results, and provide direct leadership to product managers in the Rider Experience product area

¬†

¬†

About You:

  • Solid¬†B2B and B2C product management experience at a global scale, ideally¬†in transit and/or payments
  • Experience with people management, including mentoring and guiding product managers
  • Obsessed with creating magical customer experiences and able to do it at scale, preferably in a transit or payment product context¬†
  • A commercial mindset with a clear track record of delivering innovative and high-value solutions to hard problems¬†
  • Data hungry, and experienced at getting and analysing the data required to make evidence-based decisions that drive the right outcomes for our customers and business
  • Successfully launched new apps with high volume and positive customer response in the market in the past, and have managed multiple sizeable product lines
  • Experience working in fast-paced, high-growth organisations
  • Technology savvy, with exposure to front-end web and mobile development¬†approaches, data and analytics, integration and data standards, and customer experience technology

¬†

¬†

Some of our benefits:

  • Competitive salary package
  • 20 days of vacation per year (in addition to public holidays), plus the option to buy an additional 5 days of vacation each year. On top of this, our office is shut every year between Christmas and New Year, totalling a whopping 28+ days of vacation
  • Private Healthcare and Life Insurance via Trinet
  • Choice of a workstation
  • CA$300 per year to spend on your home office
  • Ability to work for up to 3 months per year from any country in the world
  • Enhanced family leave
  • Fun and collaborative environment with a focus on making a difference in the world

¬†

¬†

Diversity:

We celebrate multiple approaches and points of view, striving to create an environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their whole, authentic selves to work. Whoever you are, just be yourself. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply; we don‚Äôt discriminate. Also, please notify our team of your pronouns at any point in your application.¬†

¬†

Interviewing:

All interviews are expected to take place by phone or video.

¬†

Remote working:

Masabi‚Äôs flexible working policy will allow you to work entirely remotely, or from one of our offices in London, Cluj, New York, Denver or Boston. The choice about where you work from will be primarily made by you. Regardless of where you choose to work from, you will be allowed to work outside of the country of your employment for up to 3 months each year.

¬†

To find out more about who we are and how we work, please have a read about how our business reacted to the Covid pandemic: https://www.masabi.com/2021/08/02/emerging-stronger/

Requirements

None

We strongly encourage minorities and individuals from underrepresented groups in technology to apply for this position.

Diversity and inclusion aren't platitudes to us; we take them seriously. Have a look at our team and read through our blog posts to learn more about our values and discover if Mediavine is the place for you!

About Grow

Grow is a new platform by Mediavine that aims to drastically increase traffic for our publishers, broaden their audience and improve user experience. It is an embedded JavaScript widget that allows readers to bookmark pages, receive AI-driven related content recommendations, and unlock exclusive content.

We‚Äôre constantly adding new features via continuous-deployment. Some of the backend-heavy features we‚Äôve worked on recently or will be working on shortly include automated newsletters with content personalized by AI; integrations with ConvertKit, MailerLite, and Mailchimp; unlocking downloadables; our take on a link-in-bio page; and user impersonation using SAML authentication.

About You

You love to work with a talented team where you have weekly team time (we play Among Us, have Oculus Quests, and do fun group activities) and you're supported in your efforts to grow professionally. You are able to manage your time well, communicate effectively and collaborate in a fully distributed team.

You should have Senior-level experience (~6 years) building modern application backends in JavaScript/TypeScript. You have very strong skills in creating AWS Lambdas, GraphQL entities, writing TypeScript, and using PostgreSQL. You regularly write technical specifications, enjoy pair programming (we use Tuple.app!) with team members, and are experienced in writing automated tests.

You should have significant experience designing, debugging, and optimizing backend applications to make them fast and reliable. You have experience participating in code reviews and providing overall code quality suggestions to help maintain the structure and quality of the codebase.

    • Pair program with other developers and provide technical guidance to others as needed

You Have:

  • Experience working with AWS Lambdas, SES, and SQS
